intro: Gasparinia peucedanoides, commonly known as the Mexican cowpea, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round seeds that are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
